metadata.title: CVE-2014-5161 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The dissect_log function in plugins/irda/packet-irda.c in the IrDAdissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.9 does not properly strip '\n'characters, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(buffer underflow and application crash) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5161` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwireshark5 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwiretap4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwsutil4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-2').
